You’re passionate about web/software development - you even find yourself spending your free time tinkering and learning new technologies!

If any of these sound like you, then we want to hear from you! We are committed to growing 1% better every day, and we believe working at Nutshell could quite possibly make your life 1(00)% better!

About the Job

As a backend software engineer, you’ll team up with others in various stacks at Nutshell. You can hone your skills alongside a frontend team that writes for both web and mobile in React + React Native, while you build the GraphQL and cloud infrastructure that powers our app. You’ll work with the data we store in MySQL and Solr on AWS. And with our continuous integration and rapid development stack, you’ll deploy tested, peer-reviewed code to production on your first day.

Our technology stack includes:
PHP, Symfony, Nginx, MySQL, Solr, Gearman, and more, all running on AWS, managed with Ansible
React, React Native, Redux, and Webpack for web and mobile frontend tooling
Docker for local development
GitHub for code management and review
Continuous integration via Jenkins

What You’ll Get From Us!

As a product team

Nutshell’s product team offers the opportunity to learn from a smart group of teammates who support and drive one another to succeed. Today, our product group comprises nine designers and engineers. Some have decades of experience, some are just out of college with a CS degree, and a few have entered software engineering as a second career.

As a company

Opportunities to learn and thrive in a friendly, growing SaaS business
A commitment to an inclusive environment that supports our diverse team
A connection to Ann Arbor’s software and startup community through our network of friends and partners
A modern office located as an anchor tenant at Cahoots in downtown Ann Arbor
Flexibility in working modes and locations, as we regroup at our office, and support other distributed team members
The sincerity and commitment of an established company: excellent health benefits, 401(k) matching, an experienced leadership team, and a profitable, growing financial position
The opportunity to help thousands of small businesses each day
Trust and autonomy to ensure you can be the best version of you

About You

The Opportunity
In a cloud software world, who you are and what you have access to determines the risk associated with your accounts being compromised, Abnormal Security aims to build a comprehensive tool to understand the employees of our customers, and aid security professionals in assessing the risks and threats impacting their employee base. Help us build a new layer of protection that will give enterprises the same level of security for their cloud offerings as Abnormal Security's industry leading products do in the email security space.

We're looking to add a Backend Engineer to our team of world class engineers. The individual in this role will shape and elevate our Notable Events team while working closely within the Behavioral Security Products division. This role straddles the line of velocity and excellence.

As a Backend Engineer of the Notable Events team, you will:
Build and maintain high-throughput, low-latency systems that process 100s of millions of events per day to enable detection to identify notable events
Enhance our frameworks for improving detection efficiency and effectiveness
Provide operational support to maintain a high level of system uptime and performance
Create a magical work environment with colleagues and memorable interview process for candidates

You are someone who wants to make an impact. You are passionate about solving customer problems and have built up a base of skills in backend and distributed systems development to do so. You want to apply those skills on a problem that leaves the world in a better place.

We are a scrappy team: we are building a new product from scratch - this means you should be comfortable with a level of uncertainty beyond what you'd find at a more mature company or even a more mature team at Abnormal. Not every project will come with a well defined PRD - that's expected and we expect this engineer to go dig in and figure out what to do. This also means occasionally we'll ask you to do things that may not strictly fit the role of a "backend engineer" - it might mean jumping on a customer call, or digging in to help fix a frontend bug.

We are also not only a remote team, but a very distributed team, as such you will need to have excellent communication skills across both verbal and written mediums. You will need to be just as comfortable on a zoom call as writing a 1 pager project proposal to be shared across the team for technical feedback.

In this job, you will bring these skills

Skills/Experience - Required:
Experience working with building and operating distributed systems and services
3-5 Years of overall software engineering experience
Experience with Python

Skills - Nice to have:
2+ years Golang

Language: Python, Golang
Platform: AWS
Framework: Django, Spark

Employs data science techniques to support predictive analysis, social media and crowd-source data analytics, wargaming, and strategy development Employs exploratory analysis and rapid iteration techniques of large volumes of data to quickly derive intelligence.

Minimum Experience

Demonstrate comprehensive mission knowledge and skills that affirms completion of all developmental training and experiences for a Back End Software Engineer.
Demonstrate the ability to communicate understanding from information that may be incomplete, indirect, highly complex, seemingly unrelated, and / or technically advanced.
Demonstrate ability to structure analysis based on trends in reporting and a range of analytic perspectives from other analysts, organizations, and intelligence disciplines.
Demonstrate ability to work independently with minimal oversight and direction.
Demonstrate ability to collaborate and work with other IC members on information sharing, driving collection, and addressing analytic disputes and conflict resolution.
Demonstrate ability to develop concise, insightful, and comprehensive products for defense intelligence.

Desired Experience/Education

At least 4 years of experience conducting software engineering with at least a portion of the experience within the last 2 years.
Bachelor's degree from a college or university accredited by an agency recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.

Required Training/Certification

CSSLP Cert, IAT Level II
Active TS/SCI or higher clearance (Must Have)
Army Information Operations Planner Course (AIOPC) after employment begins.

What We Do:

Gridline provides access to top-tier alternative investments, creating an efficient way to gain diversified exposure to non-public assets with lower capital minimums, transparent fees, and greater liquidity.
While the traditional investing process is cumbersome, manual, and inefficient, we are redeveloping the entire system from the ground up, building a technology-first approach that makes it simple to discover, deploy and manage alternative investments.
Just as other platforms have revolutionized the financial industry (payments, lending, trading, etc), we are building the on-ramp for new journeys into alternatives by reducing complexity and putting usability at the core of our platform.
Who We Are:
Our team collectively brings decades of experience across the technology and investing landscape, and are looking to continue our growth alongside people that:
Make decisions based on data with a focus on delivering long term value
Think strategically, and can articulate what they are (and not) trying to accomplish
Take calculated risks, are open to possible failure, and continuously make progress
Are passionate about what we’re building and seek to constantly learn
Operate with a high degree of candor, authenticity, and transparency
Role Overview:
As a Software Engineer you'll own features and influence the specs, build out/modify the back-end (GO) and interact with the front-end (React), and own on-going improvements for a rapidly growing platform. You’ll be joining a small but highly talented team where you can help to drive both the mission and technical direction of Gridline.
Responsibilities & Requirements:
2+ years of full stack software engineering experience.
Experience building high-quality, scalable, and performant SaaS applications.
Ability to write clean, reliable, and highly maintainable code.
Experience with GO, MySQL, and AWS.
Bonus points for additional experience with React, Terraform/Terragrunt, and Docker.
Work in a collaborative environment with other teams to deliver optimal results
Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or related technical discipline.
Previous experience in the fintech industry is a plus.
Even if you don’t meet all the qualifications for this position but are passionate about what we’re doing, we encourage you to apply — we’d love to hear from you.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

The Veradigm Product Development team is seeking an experienced candidate with automation and performance testing skills to join our team as a Sr Performance Engineer. The qualified candidate will expand the current performance set, design, develop, implement, and execute performance test plans, cases, scripts using business requirements documents. Work closely with the entire development team and ensure performance is embedded in the products and phases of the development lifecycle. The candidate must have excellent organizational skills, verbal and written communication skills, initiative, must be detailed oriented, able to multitask and complete projects on schedule.
What you will contribute:
Act as the performance evangelist for the department.
Interact with the Solutions Management team and Product Owners to help define Performance Test requirements including user workflows, projected usage targets, and performance goals for each new feature being developed.
Help define performance KPIs for each new feature or area of the product.
Work with sprint teams as each feature is developed to ensure performance is considered and planned for and document the application profile for accurate Performance Tests.
Setup appropriate monitoring of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
Develop Performance Test Plans and Load Models as part of the test preparation.
Setup tools needed for Performance Testing.
Develop virtual user scripts using Loadrunner, and other tools as needed.
Coordinate and perform test data setup for proper execution.
Setup performance environment under test before each performance test run.
Perform Load/Performance/Stress Tests by creating and executing different sets of scenarios to accomplish different objectives based on the Load Models.
Monitor application and analyze results for transaction response times, throughput, users, errors, etc.
Present detailed reports for consumption at sprint team as well as management levels.
Document performance tooling and execution procedures in local wiki instance.
Conduct root cause analysis of all performance defects found and ensure proper resolution.
May be called upon to engage in manual / exploratory testing while researching performance issues discovered via the automated tests.
Break down large tasks and estimate work as part of Agile sprint planning.
Cultivate attitudes of open communication and team building.
Continue to enhance skills through reading, mentoring, and training (either external or internal).
The ideal candidate will have:
Technical Skills
Bachelor's Degree and minimum 5 years of experience performance testing with LoadRunner.
Experience testing both UI and back-end processes.
Experience working with development teams to pinpoint and solve performance bottlenecks.
Knowledge of testing methodologies and Agile SDLC
Experience in creation and usage of SQL queries (Microsoft SQL Server)
Experience with automation of command-line tasks using shell scripting or similar tools such as C# and the .NET Framework.
Experience with SOAP / microservice testing is preferred.
Experience with system monitoring tools is preferred.
Knowledge of Internet and web technologies

Non-Technical Skills
Effective time management.
Meticulous and detail oriented.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently without constant supervision required.
Strong sense of ownership and good follow-through skills.
Experience working as part of an Agile team.
Comfortable being on camera for team stand-ups.
Verbal and Written Communication - Strong English language communication skills required.
Innovation – Consistently contributes new and unique solutions to known product and process deficiencies.
Interpersonal Skills – Will be required to work closely within a team and collaborate with other teams within the organization. Able to handle conflict, difficult situations, and urgent issues in a professional manner. Listens carefully to all points of view to ensure a clear and common understanding is achieved.
Motivation – Self-motivated and tenacious when tackling tough technical issues
Independence/Initiative – Able to work with limited supervision, adhering to overall department and company procedures.

Product Designer
Do you get a kick out of turning complex problems into elegant user experiences? Are you interested in joining a team where you'll have wide latitude to impact the look and feel of the product? Do you want to work on a collaborative team where your ideas will matter, both internally and for customers?
Who we are:
Rockerbox is a leader in the SaaS marketing measurement field, addressing the evolving industry landscape and the emerging need for a new approach, known as "measurement 2.0". Significant industry changes over the past four years, including new privacy regulations, the deprecation of third-party cookies, and a shift in marketing spend towards harder-to-track channels such as TV, Direct Mail, and Connected TV (CTV) have rendered marketing measurement both more complex and more critical than ever.
Rockerbox addresses these challenges with a unique suite of product lines that centralize data and offer diversified measurement methodologies to marketers. The foundation of Rockerbox's solution is data centralization. Atop this foundation, the platform enables marketers to choose from a range of measurement methodologies, giving customers the flexibility to choose the most appropriate approach for their specific needs and questions.
Rockerbox is a values-driven company and people who enjoy working with us are committed to doing good work but not afraid to laugh at themselves. As a team, we are collaborative, transparent, and not afraid to admit when we're wrong — we move quickly, but we are not frantic. People who enjoy working on the Product team at Rockerbox are deeply passionate about delivering a well-constructed, valuable product to customers, curious, and eager to solve problems.
What you'd be doing:
As a Product Designer, you will be driving design research, ideation, and execution on both product enhancements and greenfield features. Your understanding of digital product design principles and insights from user research will inform the development of the product — you will drive the enhancement of the interface, making it better and easier to use. Starting from wireframes and prototypes to polished visual designs, you will help the team release product experiences that delight and empower our customers.
Some of the functions you'll take on include:
Work with product, engineering, and customer success to understand how our customers use Rockerbox and what they need to succeed
Analyze user behaviors and identify pain points and areas of improvement
Produce concepts and prototypes, in both low and high fidelity, to test and validate ideas
Collaborate with engineering teams to drive deliverables to implementation
Communicate your design work and the reasonings for your design decisions across the company
Help develop and evolve the Rockerbox design system
Who you are:
You deeply care about creating intuitive interfaces and appreciate the challenge of doing so for enterprise customers seeking to understand complex data. You communicate transparently, and enjoy collaborating with others. You create a balance between designing a beautiful UI and making robust functionality available to users. You enjoy thinking through complex problems and iterating through your ideas alongside your colleagues.
People from a variety of backgrounds could excel in this role, and our ideal candidate will bring:
4+ years experience as a Product Designer
Prior experience designing B2B software product with a complex, data-rich back end
Experience designing analytics products or data visualizations
Demonstrated success leading a design process from research to ideation to prototyping and iteration to collaboration with engineering to release
Experience with design and prototyping tools like Figma, Sketch, InVision
Why you'd love us:
If you are looking for a low-ego tech startup where you can learn a complex system end-to-end, and join the company as we are accelerating to scale, Rockerbox is the place for you. You'll have an early, instrumental role as we revamp the look and layout of the product, and your work will help set the foundation for future designers.
We're not your typical analytics company — Rockerbox uses data to give people actionable insights that they use to make budget decisions every day. You'll support innovative, customer-centric brands as they take on established players by giving them the tools they need to win. We use data to tell stories about who a company's customers are and why some marketing is better than others.
Not least, you'll work alongside colleagues who support each other to continually improve and deliver exceptional value, in a collegial, helpful environment — we genuinely like each other as people, and work together to make good things happen for all of us.
What you can expect when you get here:
We ship solid product quickly: We set the bar high and move fast. Our team is dedicated to excellence and efficiency, ensuring we meet aggressive timelines while maintaining quality, and iterating as we go.
Collaboration and support: While we push for quick progress, we do so as a united team. Our environment fosters collaboration, support, and mutual respect, making our fast-paced journey enjoyable and fulfilling.
A balance of urgency and camaraderie: Even during high-pressure times, we maintain a sense of community. This looks like sharing cooking photos, pets in costumes, travel tips and other fun things while maintaining attention on mission-critical work and deadlines.
Encouragement for builders: If you're eager to build and accelerate growth, you'll find your place here. We appreciate those who are hungry to make an impact and move quickly.
Flexibility and commitment: While we value hard work and dedication, we also recognize the importance of personal time and protect it, especially outside critical periods. Our team enjoys the flexibility to manage personal responsibilities and downtime, while simultaneously driving a dynamic, results-oriented environment.
Compensation + Benefits
Salary: $120,000 - $140,000 + equity
Remote-first - work anywhere in the US
Health, vision, and dental insurance
Unlimited PTO
10 Paid Holidays
Rockerbox Unplugged - we shut down the last week of the year
12 weeks Parental Leave for all parents of a new child
Traditional and ROTH 401k options
$1000 annual training stipend
Interview Process
Broadly, our interview process can be expected to unfold as follows:
Initial interview with Val Kirilova, Head of People + Talent via Google Meet
Hiring manager interview with Nate Jones, Head of Product via Google Meet
Team loop: interviews with members of our Product and Engineering teams, our CEO, and our CTO
Rockerbox is a remote-first, equal opportunity employer and we actively encourage applicants from underrepresented backgrounds.

Job Summary
The mission of the Software Engineer is to work with our software application team to achieve our business’ digital goals. The ideal candidate for this position is a hands-on professional with .NET and back-end development experience, and an ability to translate our business needs into client-friendly functions that will expand upon our existing software products. In addition, the candidate should be able to initiate new software requirements and see to completion the entire development process. The Software Engineer will be responsible for implementing feature requests on our existing .NET and API applications, as well as gathering requirements and implementing new internal and external products as the need arises.

Job Responsibilities
Collaborate within a cross-disciplined team (design, product, data, and marketing) to support our departments and help solve their business problems through analysis of existing systems, applications, and processes.
.NET back-end development of software solutions across full lifecycle Agile projects – design, development, testing, implementation, deployment, and maintenance.
Build and deploy highly customized .NET and back-end applications supporting interactive web and mobile clients in Azure.
Enjoy participating in all aspects of product development including generating ideas, prototyping, and building solutions, talking to users, testing outcomes, and integrating learnings into future work.
Want to learn new languages, paradigms, patterns, and frameworks.
Enjoy using your creativity and resourcefulness to tackle unexpected challenges.
Other duties as assigned.

Education
B.S. or B.A. in Computer Science or relevant field of work preferred.

Qualifications and Experience
1+ years of hands-on experience in software development with skills including:
Backend: C#, .NET, Entity Framework, REST APIs.
Cloud: Azure.
Dev Ops: Terraform preferred.
Software Engineering: Azure DevOps, Agile Ceremonies, Responsive Design.
Authentication: Open ID Connect, Azure B2C, Active Directory
Testing / Test-Driven Development.
Git.
Front-end development experience is a plus (React / React Native).
Deep understanding of software engineering concepts (requirements, development methodologies, testing and documentation) and an understanding of how technology applies to business concepts.
Strong understanding of full solution architecture, REST APIs, general .NET functions and standards.
Understanding of the software development lifecycle: Git, branching, pull requests, CI/CD, UAT, production deployment.
Well-versed in object-oriented design and development concepts.
Comfortable working within a fast-paced, collaborative, Agile/Scrum project environment.
Excellent organizational and verbal/written communication skills.

Supervisory Responsibility
This position has no supervisory responsibilities.

Work Environment
This job generally operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines. The noise level in the work environment is low.

Physical Demands
The physical demands here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential job functions of this job.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to sit; stand; walk; use hands and fingers to handle or feel; and reach with hands or arms.

Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to focus.

Travel
Travel not required.

Other Duties
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

About Salesforce
We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.
Salesforce Health Cloud is looking for a Lead Software Engineer to join our team. You will be working with a group of world-class engineers, architects and product managers to build the breakthrough features salesforce.com ’s Health Cloud customers will love, adopt and use while keeping the application stable and scalable. You have a solid understanding of the MVC pattern, an obsession with commenting your code, a natural tendency to self-test your code before calling it done and a knack for building quality user experience. You’ll be a part of a modern, lean, self-governing engineering team where you have the ability to switch hats between coding to features, to testing for quality, performance to writing release management automation.

You must have a solid background in Java programming and an understanding of Javascript, CSS, SOAP XML, and HTML. You will be responsible for developing and through all phases of the front-end to the back-end development lifecycle. You will use your experience to work with team members to develop new application feature set, as well as, enhance existing code and framework. You should have a history of building successful Web-based solutions using Web Services and the ability to grasp a variety of unfamiliar technology and integrate them quickly.

This job requires that you be a self-starter with the ability to work under pressure and handle multiple tasks simultaneously. You must possess good oral and written documentation skills and be able to interact with other team members to deliver fast and reliable code. You will also be asked to contribute ideas and provide feedback on many projects within the team’s portfolio.

Required Skills/Experience:
12+ years of experience in web-based software development
Leads feature development being delivered by multiple engineers.
Architect and evolve service for features, scale, manageability and other key aspects of modern at-scale services.
Evaluate multiple technologies and options available, use your judgement to figure out what is best for the service(s)
Own service in production and be the subject matter expert
Be technically hands-on, independently design and deliver code for features of large complexity
Work with senior members across other clouds and influence architecture, quality strategy, product and processes
Positively impact other members, including not under direct area of ownership with informal coaching and mentoring
Be a key player in architectural initiatives, roadmap and technology direction balancing long-term platform velocity with short-term customer needs
Provides oversight through code and design reviews for features delivered by other developers within their scrum team.
Bachelor's degree - ideally in Computer Science, Engineering or MIS

Desired Skills
Proven experience as an owner / key team member of large scale distributed systems for high volume workloads
A strong adherent to software engineering best practices which enable building world class products such as unit testing, modular code, right abstractions, continuous integration mindset etc
Strong data structure and algorithms skills and extensive programming experience, preferably in Java/c#
Experience developing in an enterprise environment - source code control, continuous deployment, release management

York Space Systems was founded to radically improve spacecraft affordability and reliability, transforming, and enabling next generation space mission operations worldwide. Today, it is one of the most innovative aerospace companies, specializing in both end-to-end customer solutions and the rapid production of spacecraft platforms. York’s complete Space Segment Solution including spacecraft production, payload integration, system integration & test, launch services, ground segment services, and mission operations enables customers to leverage York’s existing technology solutions to get rapidly and responsively to orbit. We’re looking to expand our team across the board.

We are looking for a software engineer who is excited about building software to operate spacecrafts. Our ground operations software is a modern (React/TypeScript, C# .NET 6) web-based application which operators use to monitor and task space vehicles. You’ll be responsible for working with engineers, operators, and customers to understand requirements and implement features, bug fixes, and other improvements. Prior space-industry experience is not required.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop key user-facing features to support both current and future missions using React.js, Typescript and C#.
Translate designs and requirements into high quality code.
Develop APIs and other business logic.
Work with operators to improve the usability of the software.
Work with the flight software team to ensure compatibility and provide support for specialized payloads.
Develop management tools for our command and telemetry definitions database
Mentor more junior team members.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
2-3 years of software engineering.
Full-stack web development experience. Including JavaScript and at least one back-end language.
Experience in React.js.
Experience with SQL databases.
Experience with modern security practices.
DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Computer science degree.
TypeScript experience.
Strongly typed backend language, such as C# or Java.
Experience with multi-threaded applications.
Strong verbal and written communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills with the ability to work in a team environment.
Docker experience.
Experience with modern state management tools such as Recoil.js, React Query, Mobx, etc.
Familiarity with times series databases such as InfluxDB.
Familiarity with data visualization tools and Grafana.
Security Clearance.

2+ years as a Full-stack developer

API integration and development experience using REST and HTTP methods
Strong Object-Oriented Programming skills

WHAT WE OFFER:
This is a salaried position. Service Metal wants to compensate you for your hard work and experience because we value your input on our team. In addition, we offer one of the best benefits packages in the industry. In addition to being paid weekly you will be getting full benefits after 90 days (about 3 months), that include premiums fully paid by the company for Health, Dental, Life, and Disability insurance. Also, the Company offers a Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) and will reimburse our employees for their medical deductibles. We offer numerous other optional benefits for employees and their families.

We offer a 401K retirement plan with a 3.5% match from the company. We also offer participation in a profit-sharing plan, with a discretionary company contribution, after the first year.

PTO (Paid Time Off) is earned weekly, paid holidays, a floating holiday, and paid parental leave are all offered.

We pay a yearly bonus based on the company meeting targeted goals.
And best of all, we offer a positive atmosphere of teamwork and inclusion.

Service Metal is expanding, and we are becoming the most respected pipe, valve, and flange master distributor in the industry. We strive to make the customer experience easier and faster through world-class customer service with a commitment to excellence, integrity, and efficiency.

Rivet Overview
Rivet is an early-stage tech startup that builds modern tools (revenue cycle management products) for healthcare providers to improve efficiency and transparency in the system for all! We have a strong presence in large and small medical practices but are expanding to serve the hospital segment as well.
About this position:
A Customer Success Manager will be assigned 30-100 customers (depending on the organizations and market segment you’re assigned to) and is responsible for training customers post-implementation, driving adoption and usage of the purchased products, identifying and fixing account configurations when applicable, managing assigned accounts and the relationships therein, and are ultimately measured and compensated based on renewal of your assigned customer accounts.
Job description:
Be the product (and industry) expert for hospitals and physician groups

Identify upsell opportunities within your assigned accounts
Ultimately, your job is to drive the successful renewal and expansion of your accounts, and this is how you will be measured (and what bonus compensation will be based on). Excellent attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication
Self-starter mindset with a focus on continuous improvement
Strong time management and organizational skills
Effective presentation skills to demo new functionality and training

Health Savings Account (HSA) with company contributions per paycheck!

Description
Join Sedaro as an early and critical team member as we develop the world’s first digital twin platform for complex systems. Sedaro is hiring a Back-End Software Engineer to help achieve our mission of building infinitely scalable space system simulation software in the cloud.
The ideal candidate will have proven experience building and delivering web service applications and understand how to build scalable back-end systems. The Back-End Software Engineer has a thoughtful approach to decision-making; knowing when to move fast and when to be thorough.
This position will celebrate autonomy, give and receive constructive feedback, and have a strong ability to meet tight deadlines. Each Back-End Software Engineer is motivated to own a project from start to finish and is able to understand the big-picture and how it fits within all aspects of the business. This person is familiar with many industry tools and frameworks, including Python and JavaScript/TypeScript, and is able to write clean and maintainable code.

About Sedaro
Sedaro is an exceptionally stable venture-backed startup pushing the boundaries of distributed system design and operations in aerospace and beyond. Our product is a platform-as-a-service that enables our customers to rapidly develop and operate complex hardware systems, reducing costs, closing gaps, and overcoming bias, security, and privacy issues.
Sedaro is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment with opportunities to contribute and grow for all employees, business partners, and customers.

What you'll do
Own the architecture, design, implementation, testing, and deployment of a segment of the backend system and maintain a stable server environment
Routinely inspect server code for speed optimization and conceptualize and implement solutions for efficient data storage, access, processing, and visualization
Write unit, functional, and integration tests for the services and features you add, as well as find and adopt new ones to further increase maintainability and velocity
Support bug fixes and feature development of existing backend components
Participate in design iterations providing engineering feedback for product specs
Keep up-to-date with industry and language best practices to suggest potential improvements to our existing code base
Create and oversee testing schedules to optimize user interface and experience, ensuring optimal display on various browsers and devices

Who you are
You have a large capacity for attention to detail and a strong ability to meet tight deadlines
You enjoy solving highly complex problems related to web applications and parallel distributed systems
You are self-motivated and driven, with the ability to work independently
You are motivated by the opportunity to own a project from start to finish
You appreciate the big picture and are eager to understand how your work fits within and affects the overall business
You are smart and innovative, with the ability to think outside the box
You have a genuine appreciation for early-stage startup culture
Who you'll work with
A humble team who appreciates the value of different opinions
Team members with backgrounds in manufacturing, web development, hardware design, and UI/UX. We leverage different skill sets to approach problems from many angles, but keep the customer experience as our #1 priority
We aim to have fun and build a product that delights, surprises, and gets our customers excited

You will thrive in this position if you
Are passionate about clean, user-friendly web applications
Can balance developing both a minimum viable product (MVP) at first and optimizing and improving the MVP over time
Enjoy working with small, fast-paced, cross-functional teams
Like building independently and owning a huge chunk of the codebase
Seek significant back-end design challenges such as data streaming, big data analytics and visualization, and centralized error handling
Have a strong passion for user experience and product design

Responsibilities
Architect, design, implement, test, and deploy the backend system
Maintain a stable environment, while leveraging the development team to build a phenomenal product
Own a specific segment of the code base and continuously improve upon it
Routinely inspect code for speed optimization, bug fixes, and feature development
Participate in design iterations providing engineering feedback for product specs
Implement experimental productivity apps

Requirements
5+ years of experience developing web service applications in Python
Own the cloud-based application architecture that utilizes parallel distributed simulation
Experience with analytics, testing, and crash reporting
Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, gRPC, and REST APIs
Bachelor’s degree in CS or similar

Preferred
Master’s degree or higher in CS or similar
Experience architecting and maintaining CI/CD pipelines
Experience with AI/ML and natural language processing

Benefits
Industry-leading career development opportunities
Equity
Competitive salary
Unlimited PTO
401(k) with 4% match
100% premium payment for Medical Insurance

Work Location
In-person is preferred, but remote work is available
Office is located in the heart of Arlington, VA 1 block north of the Ballston Mall.

We seek a highly skilled and experienced Mid-Level Front-End Engineer to join our remote team. As a Mid-Level Front-End Engineer, you will play a key role in front-end development, focusing strongly on React. With a minimum of 3 years of front-end development experience, including at least two years in React, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining complex front-end systems and user interfaces. Your expertise in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React will be crucial in delivering high-quality solutions. Experience with version control systems such as Git is expected, and a solid understanding of back-end technologies would be advantageous.
Responsibilities :
Lead the development and maintenance of front-end systems and user interfaces, primarily focusing on React and other modern JavaScript frameworks.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to gather and translate project requirements into robust technical solutions.
Architect and implement scalable and high-performance front-end architecture and infrastructure.
Integrate front-end components with back-end APIs and services as necessary.
Continuously optimize application performance, ensuring security and robustness.
Take charge of troubleshooting and resolving complex issues, identifying and addressing root causes.
Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends relevant to front-end development.
Qualifications and Skills:
Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in front-end development.
Strong proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Demonstrated expertise and two years of experience in React and other modern JavaScript frameworks.
Familiarity with version control systems like Git.
A basic understanding of back-end technologies is a plus.
Solid grasp of asynchronous programming and RESTful API design principles.
Exceptional problem-solving skills and meticulous attention to detail.
Effective communication and collaboration skills, with a proven ability to work in a remote team setting.
Knowledge of Vue.js a plus
Availability to work during US hours to align with client requirements.
Reporting Structure : The Mid-Level Front-End Engineer will report to the Development Manager or Project Manager, depending on the project's structure. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams and may work closely with back-end developers, designers, or project managers as needed.
Company Culture and Benefits : We foster a collaborative, inclusive work environment that encourages continuous learning and growth. As a remote employee, you will have the flexibility to work from your preferred location. We offer competitive compensation packages, including benefits, and provide opportunities for professional development and advancement within the company. At Code Particle, we're not just passionate about innovation and continuous learning, we're equally committed to promoting a healthy work-life balance. Our diverse, global team thrives in a culture of respect, transparency, and collaboration. We believe in working smart, not hard, and we provide our team with the tools and support they need to excel in a fast-paced tech industry.
We've built a thriving remote culture that values flexibility and adaptability. Our team enjoys the freedom to manage their work in a way that suits their lifestyle, ensuring they can deliver their best while also having time for personal pursuits. But we're not all work and no play. We invest in social activities and learning opportunities, creating a vibrant, connected community despite the physical distance. From virtual lunch & learns to online social events, we ensure our team feels engaged and part of the Code Particle family.
At Code Particle, we offer more than just jobs. We offer careers filled with growth, learning, and fun in a flexible and supportive environment that truly respects work-life balance. Join us and be part of our exciting journey.

Campus/College Information:
Founded in 1856, University of Maryland, College Park is the state’s flagship institution. Our 1,250-acre College Park campus is just minutes away from Washington, D.C., and the nexus of the nation’s legislative, executive, and judicial centers of power. This unique proximity to business and technology leaders, federal departments and agencies, and a myriad of research entities, embassies, think tanks, cultural centers, and non-profit organizations is simply unparalleled. Synergistic opportunities for our faculty and students abound and are virtually limitless in the nation’s capital and surrounding areas. The University is committed to attracting and retaining outstanding and diverse faculty and staff that will enhance our stature of preeminence in our three missions of teaching, scholarship, and full engagement in our community, the state of Maryland, and in the world.

Background Checks
Offers of employment are contingent on completion of a background check. Information reported by the background check will not automatically disqualify you from employment.

Position Summary/Purpose of Position:
The Applied Research Laboratory for Intelligence & Security (ARLIS) – a University Affiliated Research Center (UARC) under the UMD Vice President for Research (VPR) is a growing organization with a core mission to support the government’s security and intelligence communities. ARLIS aims to integrate social and behavioral sciences, AI, and computing for new Human Domain applied research and development capabilities.
ARLIS seeks to hire Back-End Software Developers. Exceptional candidates in all areas related to the ARLIS’s current research trajectories will be given serious consideration, particularly those with experience in multiple areas.
You will be part of up to two to three project teams, which might include:
Studying the spread, impact, and countering of misleading and harmful information online and offline.
Evaluating and understanding how information and its flow (e.g., social media) impacts the operational environment and identifying how it can be used to affect behavior.
Supporting test and evaluation, as well as validation and verification efforts, by developing a “test harness”, or a framework or software package that facilitates design, set-up, tracking, and preserving documentation of systematic evaluation of multiple machine learning frameworks on multiple evaluation data sets.
Strengthening the interdisciplinary and sociotechnical considerations being applied to the design, development, test, and evaluation of human-machine interfaces (to include augmented and virtual reality (AR/VR)), human-systems integration, and augmentation of human performance.

As a Back-End Software Developer, you will be expected to:
Apply sound engineering and computer science principles to design, build, and test systems in support of multidisciplinary research projects
Collaborate closely as a member of interdisciplinary research teams to:
Develop and understand research goals
Provide feedback on engineering constraints
Develop software, including user interfaces, that meet stakeholder requirements, budget, and timelines
Coordinate closely with engineering team to:
Research new technologies and propose solutions to research needs
Translate research requirements into technical specifications
Document, test, and evaluate code for quality
Participate in code reviews and ship code frequently
Develop fully functional web applications that align with business objectives
Optimize and refactor designs, systems, and processes to improve code efficiency and time-to-production
Follow modular approach to increase reusability and scalability of code
Take initiative to solve problems, fix critical errors, and raise important issues to appropriate level of management
If you are a more senior experienced professional, you also will:
Engage with technical specialists and sponsors to ensure the development of tools that provide mission utility and operational gain.
Work closely with social-technical scientists and engineers to develop overall solutions.
Mentor technical development of junior software developers.
Work alongside other developers to design, implement, and test software solutions.
Identify and create software architectural designs, manage software tasks, and document progress throughout the full development life-cycle.
Participate in field evaluation of applications and iterate accordingly based on performance and in response to emergent technical and operational requirements.
Work as part of a multi-disciplinary opportunity capture team in a matrixed organization with a collaborative and team-centric culture.

This is a full-time professional track faculty position (PTK) at the University of Maryland with benefits. Salary is dependent on experience, qualifications, and hiring level. Review of applications will begin immediately and continue on a rolling basis.

Title: Junior Developer

The Los Angeles Dodgers Baseball Systems team is committed to building and maintaining the technological platforms for baseball data, analysis, and decision-making for the Dodgers, and to providing technical expertise and advice across Dodger Baseball Operations. We focus on both the tools needed to put a winning team on the field today and those we need to ensure a winning future. The software applications group within Baseball Systems designs, implements, and maintains the user-facing applications used across Baseball Operations and their supporting services. These applications are the hub of communication and collaboration for baseball executives, coaching, scouting, player development, and analytics.
The Junior Developer will join an application group within Baseball Systems to support new development and operations for existing applications. You will be responsible for implementing new functionality in existing applications to build the collaboration needed for a winning baseball team. You will support the health of our platform across cloud-based and mobile deployment. You will collaborate with the rest of Baseball Operations to make sure that the technology platform we provide them is complete, accurate, and meets their needs.
We work together to build and maintain a winning, industry-leading team. If you are also enthusiastic about baseball and want to see your work reflected on the field and in the box score, please contact us!
Essential Duties/Responsibilities:
Implement and document supports systems and tools for key decision-makers in Baseball Operations
Collaborate with scouting, player development, coaching, and other departments to understand requirements and translate them to functional design specifications
Build, test, and deploy scalable and dependable web and mobile applications for data dissemination and coordinating work across baseball activities
Write scripts to support data collection, automation, and report generation from league, vendor, and internal sources
Perform other related duties as assigned
Basic Requirements/Qualifications:
S. or M.S. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field
Experience with both front- and back-end development
Experience with web (Javascript preferred) and scripting (Python preferred) languages
Familiarity with SQL query design and optimization
Familiarity with cloud-based and distributed computing (AWS preferred)
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

Forward is on a bold mission to make high quality healthcare available to a billion people across the globe. We’re building the world’s most advanced healthcare platform from the ground up, combining hardware, software and doctors under one roof. We are building our IT team and looking for a world-class IT Engineer with expertise in improving and scaling IT systems and infrastructure. As an early member of our IT team, you’ll have a key role in building the future of healthcare from first principles.

Forward was founded in January 2016 by former executives and engineering leaders from Google and Uber. We are funded by some of the world's best investors and entrepreneurs including Founder's Fund, Khosla Ventures, First Round Capital, Eric Schmidt (Google/Alphabet Chairman), Marc Benioff (Salesforce Founder), Joe Lonsdale (Palantir Founder), Joshua Kushner (Oscar co-Founder) and Garrett Camp (Uber co-Founder).

Tackle problems on the boundary of software, hardware, and the real world.

Impact - You’re deeply mission-driven and you think there’s more to life than software that enables puppy ears to be superimposed on photos. Although we concede those are cute.

Experience with the following skills is required:
JavaScript and jQuery
ReactJS / Redux / NodeJS
Micro front-end architecture
TDD, Unit Test frameworks, including Enzyme and React-Testing-Library
HTML5, CSS3, Material UI, Bootstrap, Responsive Design
Swagger.io

Working as bridge between UX Design and Application implementation with heavy React/Redux/TDD functions without excessive supervision.

Job Title: Full Stack Engineer (San Diego - Java Sprint Boot)
Job Description:
Are you looking for more than just a job? Do you want to have a voice and feel a sense of belonging? At ICW Group, we hire innovative people who consistently adapt, grow and deliver. We believe in hard work, a fun work environment, and embracing creativity that only comes about when talented people collaborate to develop solutions. Our mission is to create the best insurance experience possible.
Headquartered in San Diego with regional offices located throughout the United States, ICW Group has been named for seven consecutive years as a Top 50 performing P&C company offering the stability of a large, profitable and growing company combined with a small-company entrepreneurial spirit. Our purpose-driven ethos provides team members with opportunities to contribute, develop, and belong.
Exciting opportunity for a Full Stack Engineer with Java Sprint Boot experience to design and develop scalable front and back-end software solutions with databases, servers, and clients. This position exists is to be part of a cross-functional team responsible for the full software life cycle from conception to deployment.
This position is based out of our Home Office in San Diego, CA.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
Manages full life cycle of software development.
Designs overall architecture of web applications that optimize site functionality.
Develops and organizes web applications, structure code, and separate files. Sets up proper file hosting and configures servers and databases for website functionality.
Develops and implements software solutions with the end customer in mind.
Designs user-based interactions through effective front-end architecture.
Develops functional databases, applications, and servers to support websites on the back end.
Leads technical collaboration for front and back-end web development.
Collaborates with the engineering team to design software solutions and launch new features to meet customer needs.
Interfaces with clients, fellow developers, and other departments to develop full platforms that enhance user experience and functionality.
Defines and develops application scope and objectives and draws up technical and functional specifications for written documentation.
Leads design reviews to determine functional requirements, product designs, schedules, and potential problems.
Performs technical analysis and testing to improve software solutions.
Tests software to ensure responsiveness and efficiency. Identifies and solves coding issues.
Troubleshoots, debugs, and upgrades software.
Creates security and data protection settings.
Maintains quality and ensures responsiveness of applications. Maintains code integrity and organization.
Keeps current with industry best practices, trends, and developments to improve quality and efficiency.
WHAT YOU BRING TO THE ROLE
Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university with a major or emphasis in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or related field; or equivalent combination of education and/or experience required.
Minimum 5 years of experience required as a Full Stack Engineer or similar role.
Experience working with graphic designers and converting designs to visual elements.
Experience in development for desktop applications.
Experience with cloud message APIs and usage of push notifications.
Experience in development for mobile applications preferred.
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS
Knowledge in all stages of software development.
Familiarity with databases, web servers, and UI/UX designs.
Proficient in front and back end coding.
Highly experienced with server-side and back-end programming languages such as PHP, Python, Ruby, Java, .NET, JavaScript, Node.js, etc. Primary language focus may vary by IT department.
AWS experience preferred. Proficient experience using advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks such as AngularJS, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, ReactJS, DurandalJS etc.
Possess HTML and CSS skills for website content design. Knowledge of code versioning tools such as Git, Mercurial or SVN. Possess an understanding and implementation of security and data protection.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, and experience working with cross-functional teams, and presenting to leadership.
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office applications including Word, Visio, Excel, Project and PowerPoint.
Ability to apply principles of logic to a wide range of intellectual and practical problems. Ability to work independently with excellent organization and time management skills to complete tasks efficiently.
Ability to solve practical problems and handle a variety of variables in situations where limited standard rules exist.
COMPENSATION
The salary range listed for this position, $98,859.84 to $176,960.68, is exclusive of fringe benefits and potential bonuses. If hired at ICW Group, your final base salary compensation will be determined by factors such as skills, experience and/or education. In addition, we believe in the importance of pay equity and consider internal equity of our current team members as part of any final offer. We typically do not hire at the maximum of the range in order to allow for future and continued salary growth. We also offer a substantial benefits package outlined below.
WHY JOIN ICW GROUP?
A flexible work schedule, hybrid and remote opportunities
Challenging work and the ability to make a difference
You will have a voice and feel a sense of belonging
We offer a competitive benefits package, with generous medical, dental, and vision plans as well as 401K retirement plans
Want to continue learning? We’ll support you 100%

Job Description
Are you interested in a unique opportunity to join the team responsible for the design, implementation, and support of Ohio University’s student success initiatives? Are you ready to apply your talents and technical skills to help shape the strategies and direction of a critical institutional service? OHIO’s Office of Information Technology is looking for a results-driven candidate with excellent collaboration and communication skills to provide technical support for the university’s student success and retention CRM, implemented with Technolutions Slate. This position works closely with CRM functional leads to provide technical solutions to support the planning, development, and coordination of student success efforts.

You will serve in an advisory capacity and assist with increasing student retention and success efforts by participating in the development of CRM strategies and by enabling data driven decision making. You will partner with a team of functional leads to improve system capabilities and support mission critical university objectives. You will collaborate on complex, concurrent projects for multiple constituencies.

The successful candidate will be driven to solve problems and achieve high standards of customer service and be able to effectively communicate with a wide audience, including staff within IT, subject matter experts, end users, and university leadership. You will have the opportunity to grow your business knowledge and technical skills, and to make significant contributions to the overall success of the University.

You should have a bachelor’s degree and significant experience with back-end administration of Technolutions Slate, CRM, or a closely related application in a higher education environment.
Please be aware that the university is posting two positions, with progressively higher skill sets. Only one position will be filled. The university is posting two positions to ensure a sufficient applicant pool to meet this need. The university will first consider applicants for the higher-level position. If that applicant pool does not yield a successful candidate, the applicant pool for the lower-level position will be evaluated. You are encouraged to apply for either or both positions based upon your qualifications and interests.

Job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Research, prototype, and implement new product features.
Create, maintain and support imports, exports, and integrations with other university systems.
Develop and implement strategies to optimize duplicate resolution and to ensure date integrity.
Create, maintain and monitor Slate rules and workflows.
Create SQL queries or scripts in Slate to supplement application functionality.
Build and maintain complex queries and reports.
Develop and execute test plans for changes to functionality and changes to integrations.
Implement and administer security. Monitor systems logs and system performance.
Create and maintain detailed technical documentation.
Gain and maintain in-depth knowledge of the functionality provided by Technolutions Slate, best practices established by the Slate community, and Ohio University business processes.
Research product features and make recommendations to enrollment management leadership to achieve strategic objectives.

This position is fully remote and will enjoy flexible scheduling options, too.

Bachelor’s Degree
3+ years of experience maintaining the technical configuration of a CRM implementation or of a closely related application.
3+ years of experience with data management (SQL queries, data exports and imports, data integrity, duplicate resolution, configuring and administering data security, etc.).
Experience with web technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, XML, etc.

Experience maintaining the technical configuration of a Technolutions Slate implementation.
Experience with PeopleSoft Campus Solutions.
Experience with admission and recruiting processes in higher education.
Effective written and verbal communication skills with both IT resources and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience in higher education.

Concourse Labs is the leader in automated, continuous cloud security governance. We are the innovator in Security-as-Code, the most effective way to secure cloud applications and data. The Security-as-Code approach defines security and control objectives as code and automatically applies them as policy to ensure cloud services and applications are configured and used securely. Thisl approach is based on the following key principles:
Creating security policies as code
Managing policy throughout its full lifecycle, in a manner analogous to how modern application code is developed, tested, and managed
Thorough testing and quality assurance of security policies before they are deployed
Seamless integration of security controls into continuous development and delivery pipelines, shifting security left
Continuously monitoring cloud runtime environments for compliance with security policy
Delegating and tracking remediation activity and automatically revalidating changes
Concourse Labs instantiates these key principles in an easy-to-use and quick to deploy SaaS platform that enables any organization to quickly and confidently understand, improve and manage its cloud security posture. With Concourse Labs and our Security-as-Code approach organizations can:
Prevent the #1 cause of cloud data breaches
Implement effective, scalable, and customized cloud security in days
Immediately measure security posture against industry standards and best practices
We're looking for people who are ready to jump in and help us build on our incredible momentum, our diverse, engaged workforce, and our purpose to help our customers ensure the security of their cloud applications, operations, and data.

About Us:
ACME Technologies is both a payment infrastructure provider and a cloud application provider. Our core ticketing and membership applications are powered by ACME Pay, our payment infrastructure that can be used by any SaaS company seeking to monetize payments.
Our cloud application stack is composed of eCommerce (B2C) and web-based Backoffice (B2B) applications as well as Point of Sale and Access Control applications for in-venue sales and scanning.
Our payment infrastructure stack is a modern API layer with SDKs, providing a rich omnichannel (online and POS) interface at the payment acceptance layer all the way to back office management and daily payout to sellers, with a global footprint. See acmepayments.com.
Our back-end infrastructure is modern, elastic, and based on the latest java microservices architectures and modern REST API principles. The challenges are great to keep our infrastructure reliable, and secure, with high uptime and high performance as we process the main integrated payment use cases for our app layer and external API clients. If you like great engineering challenges, it’s hard to find better; we do deep technology.
Our culture is collaborative and quite flat in terms of hierarchies. Given we build mission-critical systems, we take pride in being a low-key, solution-oriented company that deals with problems productively and collaboratively. Everybody is part of the solution. As a core deep tech company, we focus on great engineering to support our clients and sales.
Role:
As a member of the core engineering infrastructure team at ACME, you will contribute at a foundational level to our growing multi-product portfolio and have lots of fun keeping our infrastructure up and highly performant at scale.
Responsibilities:
Help keep our 99.9%+ SLAs with fast response time.
Manage our AWS cloud presence.
Develop an automation infrastructure to build, deploy, and manage DevOps.
Help scale the site horizontally as traffic grows.
Manage security to keep our data center PCI Level 1 compliant.
Expand the 24x7 monitoring and alerting system for our build and test infrastructure.
Perform ongoing research into new infrastructure tools to improve our stack.
Requirements:
Experience in building fault-tolerant and scalable systems.
Significant development experience in at least one modern programming language like Ruby or Python and shell scripting.
Experience developing and architecting database solutions using both SQL and non-SQL databases, such as MySQL and MongoDB.
Experience with monitoring solutions and services.
Experience with container orchestration tools like Kubernetes.
Professional experience with Git and Jenkins. You have set up Jenkins by writing an ansible playbook.
Strong knowledge of UNIX internals, as well as excellent UNIX administration skills, used daily.
Knowledge of web application servers (Apache, Tomcat) and HAProxy.
Experience with configuration management and CI/CD. Ansible, Jenkins preferred.
Thorough experience building and managing environments in the AWS cloud, especially with Terraform, and Terraform Export.
Experience working in a 24x7 on-call environment.
Firm understanding of service-oriented architecture and common backend infrastructure setup/configuration such as databases, search engines, caches, queues, proxies, load balancers, etc.
Strong sysadmin skills. You have used iptables.
Exceptional communication and troubleshooting skills.
Perks:
We have a collaborative, common sense, no-nonsense culture, with excellent employee and customer retention. Our customers are some of the biggest, best-known name brands in the museum, and aquarium spaces, and include all the Presidential Libraries.
We provide all the tools you need for success in a highly collaborative environment. For those in the Bay Area opting to be onsite, we have a San Jose office within walking distance of Caltrain. If this sounds like a tempting challenge where you can make your mark developing a globally useful, cutting-edge product, while working in a positive, friendly environment, we want to hear from you. This is a full-time position.

This is a remote position.

Summary:
The Child Mind Institute (CMI) is seeking a Senior Backend/DevOps Engineer for Mindlogger, a platform that empowers clinicians, researchers, and educators to digitally deliver mental health assessments and interventions for children, teens, and young adults. This 20-month position will help CMI, through its partnership with California’s Department of Health Care Services (DHCS), build the next generation of the MindLogger platform. As part of CMI’s research team, our mission is to accelerate the pace of scientific innovation and discovery in mental health and learning, and help foster collaborations that can test, improve upon, and adopt innovative solutions for the benefit of every child.
The Senior Backend/DevOps Engineer will play a pivotal role in the evolution of the MindLogger platform, owning all evaluation and internal implementation of solutions on the backend. You will maintain a deep technical knowledge of the MindLogger platform and drive the transition of our DevOps processes and infrastructure from external vendors in-house. As an individual contributor, you’ll immerse yourself in our backend codebase and be responsible for driving architectural decisions while working collaboratively to amplify the performance, security, and accessibility of our APIs. Working closely with the Engineering Director and Senior Engineering Director, you will help define the strategy and vision for the product (10%), implement features on the backend system and manage DevOps processes and infrastructure (50%), and architect and design future features for external execution/implementation (40%).
Reporting to the Engineering Director for MindLogger this is a full-time, exempt position located in our NYC headquarters or California office. A hybrid schedule is possible.
The Child Mind Institute is proud to be named a Great Place to Work-Certified company! Our competitive compensation and benefits include medical insurance, 401(k), paid parental leave, dependent care, flexible work schedules, discounted tickets and entertainment perks programs. For more information about our benefits, please visit our employee benefits website.
Child Mind Institute is committed to creating an inclusive culture where all employees feel welcomed and valued.

Responsibilities:
Own MindLogger backend technical orchestration, ensuring optimal performance, security, and scalability while delivering new features and capabilities.
Architect, develop, and maintain efficient backend systems.
Manage and scale the backend API, including considerations for security, scale, and compliance with industry standards.
Be a technical leader to our existing development team of internal and external engineers.
This is a highly technical senior IC role; candidates should be prepared to be hands-on with code and systems while mentoring others.
Help lead existing devops engineering to configure, standup, and optimize DevOps infrastructure (CI/CD, monitoring, alerting, etc).
Resolve production errors through root cause analysis.
Mentor and uplift non-technical staff; collaborate with cross-functional teams (including external resources) for tailored feature implementation.
Oversee backend planning; manage external engineering deliverables in collaboration with the Engineering Director.
Manage internal and external team communication; contribute to future backend and DevOps architectural designs.

8+ years of experience working with a production-level backend, with expertise in Python, AWS, and relational databases (PostgreSQL preferred).
4+ years DevOps or infrastructure automation experience.
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Proficient in cloud environments (AWS, Azure or GCP), networking, and cybersecurity principles.
Strong problem-solving skills, with a focus on operational efficiency and automation.
Excellent communication skills, able to collaborate effectively with leaders and senior stakeholders and provide high-level support outside engineering as necessary.
Ability to adapt to and work between fast-paced prototype efforts and larger internal feature implementations.
A proactive approach to identifying and resolving challenges and enhancing system performance and security.

Master’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field is highly preferred.

About Cognite and Cogniters
Cognite is a global leader in industrial software with our Industrial DataOps platform, Cognite Data Fusion®, at the core. We were awarded the 2022 Technology Innovation Leader for Global Digital Industrial Platforms.

The Product team is the team responsible for developing Cognite Data Fusion as a robust and scalable platform for solving industrial data problems at Cognite. The industrial data problem is at the heart of transforming asset-intensive industries to be safer, more sustainable and more profitable. Cognite’s Cognite Data Fusion makes the operational data available at scale and adds value to the data through data processing. This enables asset-intensive industries to make data-driven decisions. Our platform is built on many different technologies, each good at solving various challenges.

To build the best possible product, we believe in autonomous teams with developers, designers and product managers working closely together. Our teams are working on building the next-generation industrial data platform and applications across many different industries, such as Oil & Gas, Manufacturing, and Power & Utility. This includes enabling all types of workflows, including analytics, to assist in making better decisions. We are a good mix of engineers, products, and design. What we have in common is that we care deeply about the user experience and create products that users really want to use.

Our work environment is exciting, dynamic and intense. You will work with the best domain and industry experts: designers, product managers, backend developers, ML engineers, 3D developers and business leaders. We support one another, ask good questions, and give each other constructive feedback. Our goal is to leverage our diverse set of strengths and backgrounds to build innovative products, to think outside the ordinary, and grind through and nurture a great culture.

This position is a hybrid role working from the Austin office. Unfortunately, no relocation assistance is budgeted.
A typical day as a Cogniter will contain the following tasks & responsibilities
Develop Cognite Data Fusion - a robust, state-of-the-art SaaS platform for industrial data.
Implement and deploy software backends that incorporate AI systems at scale, more specifically around data extraction from documents into useful and searchable data for our customers
Stay updated with the latest AI and machine learning trends
Solve concrete industrial data problems by designing and implementing delightful APIs and robust services on top of Cognite Data Fusion. Examples include integrating data sources into our platform in a secure and scalable way and enabling high-performance data science pipelines.
Work with application teams to ensure a delightful user experience that helps the user solve complex real-world problems that have yet to be solved before.
Work with distributed open-source software such as Kubernetes, Kafka, Spark and similar to build scalable and performant solutions.
Collaborate in a fast-paced environment involving different stakeholders and subject matter experts.
Be actively involved in setting product and technical direction.
Be actively involved in product and technical decisions.
We believe most of these should match you and your experience
You can prioritize your tasks and distribute your time and resources most efficiently to optimize for impact.
You write well-structured, efficient, and maintainable code and actively keep the quality of the codebase in check.
You have 5+ years of software engineering experience in one or more well-established backend programming languages, such as Python, Kotlin or C#.
You also have a few years of experience writing SaaS backend microservices at scale and experience integrating AI features into real-world applications.
You have experience with Knowledge Graphs and Graph databases like Neo4j
You have the ability to learn other coding languages and use the language best fit for purpose.
Having experience with building machine learning models, data modeling, NLP models or LLMs is a plus
Having experience with orchestrators like Netflix's Conductor service is also a plus
You have experience with cloud development, which may include Kubernetes, Docker or other related technologies.
Familiarity with Azure, AWS and GCP is a plus.
You enjoy making things happen and accepting responsibility for results. You don't just write code; you engineer the software.
You recognize when to apply fresh and imaginative ideas and when to use tried and tested solutions, and enjoy both approaches.
You are open-minded and cooperate well with others; share knowledge, experience and information effectively through oral and written communication; support others in pursuing team goals.

Don’t meet every single requirement? We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

What You Will Do
All Lowe’s associates deliver quality customer service while maintaining a store that is clean, safe, and stocked with the products our customers need. As an Back End Department Supervisor, this means:
Removing barriers, addressing inefficiencies, and enabling staff to delighting our customers.
Collaborating with front-end and back-end operations associates to ensure items are adequately stocked.
Monitoring use of store power equipment and coaching employees on safe behaviors and lifting techniques.
The Back End Department Supervisor is primarily responsible for leading and enabling a team of associates to deliver the best possible customer experience in the store. This includes coaching and training associates, delegating, following-up on daily tasks, managing performance, and ensuring adequate department coverage. The Back End Department Supervisor impacts Lowe’s mission daily by planning, scheduling, monitoring, and successfully implementing all non-selling operations in the back end of the store, facilitating the store’s ability to provide a superior customer shopping experience and maximize sales and profitability.

To be successful, the Back End Department Supervisor must collaborate and communicate with other Department Supervisors and Assistant Store Managers to determine the most effective methods for meeting service, operations, and safety objectives. The individual in this role must continuously drive efficiencies and be able to teach others the skills needed to maintain effective store operations. It is important that this associate communicate upward to keep management informed of concerns, issues, recognitions, and morale.

The Back End Department Supervisor helps keep our store safe by conducting safety walks, reporting hazards, training and monitoring staff, and understanding all safety and lifting requirements.
In addition to the responsibilities summarized above, individuals in this role may occasionally open or close the store or serve as manager-on-duty (MOD).
Travel Requirements: This role does not require regular travel; however, this role may need to travel on occasion to meetings, trainings, or to support neighboring stores.

What We're Looking For
Hourly Full Time: Generally scheduled 39 to 40 hours; more hours may be required based on the needs of the store.
Requires morning, afternoon and evening availability any day of the week.
Physical ability to perform tasks that may require prolonged standing, sitting, and other activities necessary to perform job duties.
Minimally must be able to lift 25 pounds without assistance; may lift over 25 pounds with or without assistance.
